Class Reporting

java.lang.Object
Reporting
public class Reporting
extends java.lang.Object
This is a special class called Reporting. It has several methods for manipulating the incident and district objects

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Reporting()  

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void addDistrict​(District objDistrict)
    This adds a district object to the district list (listOfDistricts).
    java.util.List<Incident> getAllIncidents​(double value)
    This method gives out a list of all incidents reported with a value greater than a given amount of money.
    District getDistrictWithLargestAverageValue​(int year)
    This method gives out the district object which has the largest incident's average value in a given year
    Incident getIncidentWithLargestValue()
    This shows the incident with the largest value ever recorded this function used the list of district to iterate through each district and the function getIncidentWithHighestValue() to get the highest value in a district
    void printDistrictList()
    This is a function displays the List of Districts

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • Reporting

      public Reporting()

  • Method Details

    • addDistrict

      public void addDistrict​(District objDistrict)
      This adds a district object to the district list (listOfDistricts).
      Parameters:
      objDistrict - the provided district with will be added to the list of districts

    • printDistrictList

      public void printDistrictList()
      This is a function displays the List of Districts

    • getDistrictWithLargestAverageValue

      public District getDistrictWithLargestAverageValue​(int year)
      This method gives out the district object which has the largest incident's average value in a given year
      Parameters:
      year - pass the year as input parameter for which average value is required
      Returns:
      return the object of district type

    • getIncidentWithLargestValue

      public Incident getIncidentWithLargestValue()
      This shows the incident with the largest value ever recorded this function used the list of district to iterate through each district and the function getIncidentWithHighestValue() to get the highest value in a district
      Returns:
      This will return the incident object that has the highest incident value

    • getAllIncidents

      public java.util.List<Incident> getAllIncidents​(double value)
      This method gives out a list of all incidents reported with a value greater than a given amount of money.
      Parameters:
      value - pass the value as input parameter for which value is required for the comparison.
      Returns:
      list of incident that has the greater value as provided in the parameter.
